div.l: He poked Iohn and seide slepist thowe
Herdest thou evir slyke as a songe or nowe
Lo whilke a complyne is twene hem alle
A wilde fire on her bodys falle
Who herde ever swilke a ferly thynge
Ye they shalle haue the flour of yll endynge
This longer nyght there tid vs no reste
But yet no force al shalbe for the beste
For Iohn seide Aleyne al so mot I thryue
If that I may the wenche wolle I swyue
Som esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn ther ys a lawe that seith thus
Than yf a mān in o thynge be agreuede
That in a nothir he shal be releuede
Oure corne is stole sothly it is no nay
And we haue had an eville fitte to day
And syn I shalle haue none amendment
Ageynste my losse I will haue esement
Be goddes sale it shalle nonothir be
This Iohn answered Aleyne avise the
The myller is a perlous mān he seide
And yf that he out of his slepe abreyde
He myght do vs bath a vilony
Aleyn answered I count hym nat a fly
And vp he riste and to the wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vpright and fast slepte
Tille he so ny was or she myght a spye
That hit had be to late for to crye
And shortly for to telle they were attone
Nowe play Aleyne for I wille speke of Iohn
This Iohn lieth stille a furlonge wey or two
div.note: Mosser's Digital Catalogue would make f. 69 (which he calls f. 70 per the foliation) the final folio in quire 6, listed as an 8. But there is a counting error: he lists Q6 as ff 63-69 (i.e. 7 folios) without loss, and Q7-Q11 as all 12s, without loss, running from ff. 70-130. As the catchword on 68v suggests, f. 69 is the opening of Q7. But that does not explain the signature "11.
